MaryBeth Sobel Schroeder

MaryBeth Sobel Schroeder is the founder of Spectrum Legal Group, LLP in Denver, Colorado. She has over twenty years of experience in corporate law, employment law, energy law and complex civil litigation. Ms. Schroeder has assisted numerous small to mid-size businesses in all facets of formation as entities and advised them on available business structure options.  She has developed, drafted, and revised numerous business documents, which reflect the individual circumstances and needs of each business client.

Ms. Schroeder is also experienced in the negotiation and litigation of various business and employment issues and has worked extensively with corporate clients conducting internal legal compliance investigations and audits. She has conducted numerous seminars and training sessions for attorneys, legal administrators, and for all levels of management and support staff in private companies in both Colorado and Wyoming.

Ms. Schroeder is a member of the Colorado and Wyoming Bar Associations.  She is a Colorado Bar Foundation Fellow Emeritus, Recognized Top Lawyers the Secrets to their Success 2017. In 2019, Ms. Schroeder received AV Preeminent Judicial Edition from her peers and the judiciary. She is an AV Preeminent Attorney 2019 and listed in the Bar Register of Preeminent Woman Lawyers 2019.  She received her undergraduate degree in Business Administration and Economics from Regis University and her J.D. degree from the University of Denver, Sturm College of Law.  She obtained a Safety and Health Specialist Certificate for General Industry and Oil/Gas from the OSHA Training Institute (2014). Ms. Schroeder practices in the U.S. District Court, and the states of Colorado and Wyoming.

Practice Areas:

  • Business & Corporate Law
  • Employment & Workplace Safety Law
  • Oil, Gas & Energy Law
  • Insurance Related Matters
  • Litigation
